intro: Piptospatha loi, commonly known as the golden shower tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its pendulous clusters of yellow flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, legume-like pods containing seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
